import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
%matplotlib inline

df = pd.read_csv('../input/tokyo-2021-medal-table/tokyo_2021.csv')
df
source.9fbe79b5:
x = df[df['Gold'] > 10]['Country']
y = df[df['Gold'] > 10]['Gold']
data = go.Bar(x= x,y= y)
layout = go.Layout(title = 'Top Gold Gainers')
fig = go.Figure(data=data,layout=layout)
fig.show()
source.fdee971b:
x = df[df['Gold'] < 3]['Country']
y = df[df['Gold'] < 3]['Gold']
data = go.Bar(x= x,y= y,orientation = 'v',textposition='auto',opacity=0.8)
layout = go.Layout(title = 'Simple Bar Chart',width=1000,height=500)
fig = go.Figure(data=data,layout=layout)
fig.show()

x = df[df['Total'] > 20]['Country']
y = df[df['Total'] > 20]['Total']
data = go.Bar(x= x,y= y)
layout = go.Layout(title = 'Top Medal Gainers')
fig = go.Figure(data=data,layout=layout)
fig.show()
